other.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: used to refer to the second of two people or things, which is not the one you already have or the one you have already mentioned
other.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I can’t find my other shoe.
One man was arrested, but the other one got away.
He kept shifting awkwardly from one foot to the other.
She took it for granted that each knew who the other was.
other.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: used to refer to all the people or things in a group apart from the one you have already mentioned or the one that is already known about
other.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The other hotels are all full.
She’s much brighter than all the other children in her class.
I chose this coat in the end because the other ones were all too expensive.
I can see Julie, but where have all the others gone?
other.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: used to refer to additional people or things of the same kind
other.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: There are one or two other problems I’d like to discuss.
I’ve got some other friends I’d like to invite.
The guests included, among others, Elizabeth Taylor and Michael Jackson.
other.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: used to refer to a different person or thing from the one you have already mentioned or the one that is already known about
other.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: David and Jessica were playing with two other children.
You’d better change into some other clothes.
Do you envy other women who seem to manage their lives better?
Can we discuss this some other time?
There is no other job I would rather do.
Saudi Arabia produces more oil than any other country.
I hope you will learn to show more respect for others  (=other people).
Some people are at greater risk than others.
other.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: used to refer to the thing that is opposite you, furthest from you, or moving away from you
other.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: You can park on the other side of the street.
He lives at the other end of the road.
She drove off in the other direction.
other.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0: You use other before a plural noun
other.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1: Others is a plural pronoun meaning ‘other people or things’
other.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2: Another is written as one word  Don’t write
There must be another way of doing it
